definitions.definition: To cease to have (something) in one's possession or capability .
examples: If you lose that ten-pound note, you'll be sorry.
He lost his hearing in the explosion.
She lost her position when the company was taken over.

subdefinitions.definition: To have (an organ ) removed from one's body , especially by accident .
examples: Johnny lost a tooth, but kept it for the tooth fairy.
He lost his spleen in a car wreck.
I’ve lost five pounds this week.

subdefinitions.definition: To experience the death of (someone to whom one has an attachment, such as a relative or friend ).
examples: She lost all her sons in the war.

subdefinitions.definition: To pay or owe (some wager ) due from an unsuccessful bet or gamble .
examples: Frank had lost $500 staying in Vegas.

subdefinitions.definition: To be deprived of (some right or privileged access to something).

definitions.definition: To wander from; to miss, so as not to be able to find; to go astray from.
examples: I lost my way in the forest.

definitions.definition: To be a defeated competitor in (a game, competition, trial, etc).
examples: We lost the football match.
You just lost The Game .

definitions.definition: To be defeated ( in a game, competition, contest, etc. )
examples: The team scored four goals but still managed to lose .

definitions.definition: To be unable to follow or trace (somebody or something) any longer.
examples: The policeman lost the robber he was chasing.
Mission control lost the satellite as its signal died down.

definitions.definition: To cause (somebody) to be unable to follow or trace one any longer.
examples: lose the cops
We managed to lose our pursuers in the forest.

definitions.definition: To cease exhibiting ; to overcome (a behavior or emotion).
To shed , remove , discard , or eliminate .
examples: When we get into the building, please lose the hat.

definitions.definition: Of a clock , to run slower than expected.
examples: My watch loses five minutes a week.
It's already 5:30? My watch must have lost a few minutes.

definitions.definition: To cause (someone) the loss of something; to deprive of.
To fail to catch with the mind or senses; to miss.
examples: I lost a part of what he said.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To cease to have (something) in one's possession or capability .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To wander from; to miss, so as not to be able to find; to go astray from.
( transitive ) To be a defeated competitor in (a game, competition, trial, etc).
( intransitive ) To be defeated ( in a game, competition, contest, etc. )
( transitive ) To be unable to follow or trace (somebody or something) any longer.
( transitive ) To cause (somebody) to be unable to follow or trace one any longer.
( transitive ) To cease exhibiting ; to overcome (a behavior or emotion).
( transitive , informal ) To shed , remove , discard , or eliminate .
( transitive ) Of a clock , to run slower than expected.
( ditransitive ) To cause (someone) the loss of something; to deprive of.
( transitive ) To fail to catch with the mind or senses; to miss.
